content:
ExceptionHandlingClause Class

Definition

Represents a clause in a structured exception-handling block.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public class ExceptionHandlingClause
Inheritance
System.Object
ExceptionHandlingClause

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

The ExceptionHandlingClause class provides information about the clauses in a try…catch…finally block (Try…Catch…Finally in Visual Basic). To get a list of exception-handling clauses in a method, obtain a MethodInfo that represents the method. Use the GetMethodBody method to obtain a MethodBody object, and then use the ExceptionHandlingClauses property to get the list of clauses.

Note

Working with exception-handling clauses requires a thorough understanding of metadata and Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction formats. Information can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics" and "Partition III: CIL Instruction Set". The documentation is available online; see ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards on MSDN and Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) on the Ecma International Web site.

Constructors

ExceptionHandlingClause()

Initializes a new instance of the ExceptionHandlingClause class.

protected ExceptionHandlingClause ();

Remarks

This constructor is invoked by derived classes during the construction of ExceptionHandlingClause objects.

Properties

CatchType

Gets the type of exception handled by this clause.

public virtual Type CatchType { get; }
Value
Type

A Type object that represents that type of exception handled by this clause, or null if the stem.Reflection.ExceptionHandlingClause.Flags* property is ExceptionHandlingClauseOptions or ExceptionHandlingClauseOptions.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

Invalid use of property for the object's current state.

Remarks

Note

Working with exception-handling clauses requires a thorough understanding of metadata and Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction formats. Information can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics" and "Partition III: CIL Instruction Set". The documentation is available online; see ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards on MSDN and Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) on the Ecma International Web site.

FilterOffset

Gets the offset within the method body, in bytes, of the user-supplied filter code.

public virtual int FilterOffset { get; }
Value
Int32

The offset within the method body, in bytes, of the user-supplied filter code. The value of this property has no meaning if the stem.Reflection.ExceptionHandlingClause.Flags* property has any value other than ExceptionHandlingClauseOptions.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

Cannot get the offset because the exception handling clause is not a filter.

Remarks

A filter clause contains user-suppliedMicrosoft intermediate language (MSIL) that determines whether an exception is handled by this clause. For example, any clause containing the Visual Basic When keyword is a System.Reflection.ExceptionHandlingClauseOptions clause.

Note

Working with exception-handling clauses requires a thorough understanding of metadata and MSIL instruction formats. Information can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics" and "Partition III: CIL Instruction Set". The documentation is available online; see ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards on MSDN and Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) on the Ecma International Web site.

Flags

Gets a value indicating whether this exception-handling clause is a finally clause, a type-filtered clause, or a user-filtered clause.

public virtual System.Reflection.ExceptionHandlingClauseOptions Flags { get; }
Value
ExceptionHandlingClauseOptions

An ExceptionHandlingClauseOptions value that indicates what kind of action this clause performs.

Remarks

Note

Working with exception-handling clauses requires a thorough understanding of metadata and Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction formats. Information can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics" and "Partition III: CIL Instruction Set". The documentation is available online; see ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards on MSDN and Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) on the Ecma International Web site.

HandlerLength

Gets the length, in bytes, of the body of this exception-handling clause.

public virtual int HandlerLength { get; }
Value
Int32

An integer that represents the length, in bytes, of the MSIL that forms the body of this exception-handling clause.

Remarks

Note

Working with exception-handling clauses requires a thorough understanding of metadata and Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction formats. Information can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics" and "Partition III: CIL Instruction Set". The documentation is available online; see ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards on MSDN and Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) on the Ecma International Web site.

HandlerOffset

Gets the offset within the method body, in bytes, of this exception-handling clause.

public virtual int HandlerOffset { get; }
Value
Int32

An integer that represents the offset within the method body, in bytes, of this exception-handling clause.

Remarks

Note

Working with exception-handling clauses requires a thorough understanding of metadata and Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction formats. Information can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics" and "Partition III: CIL Instruction Set". The documentation is available online; see ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards on MSDN and Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) on the Ecma International Web site.

TryLength

The total length, in bytes, of the try block that includes this exception-handling clause.

public virtual int TryLength { get; }
Value
Int32

The total length, in bytes, of the try block that includes this exception-handling clause.

Remarks

An integer that represents the total length, in bytes, of the try block that includes this exception-handling clause.

Note

Working with exception-handling clauses requires a thorough understanding of metadata and Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction formats. Information can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics" and "Partition III: CIL Instruction Set". The documentation is available online; see ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards on MSDN and Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) on the Ecma International Web site.

TryOffset

The offset within the method, in bytes, of the try block that includes this exception-handling clause.

public virtual int TryOffset { get; }
Value
Int32

An integer that represents the offset within the method, in bytes, of the try block that includes this exception-handling clause.

Remarks

Note

Working with exception-handling clauses requires a thorough understanding of metadata and Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction formats. Information can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics" and "Partition III: CIL Instruction Set". The documentation is available online; see ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards on MSDN and Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) on the Ecma International Web site.

Methods

ToString()

A string representation of the exception-handling clause.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A string that lists appropriate property values for the filter clause type.
